name: Tieteellisten Seurain Valtuuskunta
goal: The Federation of Finnish Learned Societies, established in 1899, is a national co-operative body for learned societies in Finland. It contributes to the co-operation between learned societies, supports and develops scholarly communication and publishing, and promotes awareness and usage of research results. It also supports and develops the role of its members in science policy discussion.
interests: Education and training, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Horizon2020
Open science policy platform
European open science research cloud
OpenAire
